messages.title: Getting a fair deal for rural communities
messages.content: At this election, rural areas face a different choice to other parts of Britain. Labour has long since disappeared as a force in rural Britain - there are no Labour MPs to vote out. The choice in these areas is who will stand up for rural Britain?

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats are fighting for rural communities starting with a tax cut that helps families on middle and lower incomes - worth an extra Â£700 a year on average.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lower petrol prices for rural areas
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will deliver lower petrol prices for rural areas.
We will deliver policies that will get our economy moving again.
We will take action to deliver affordable housing - so that young people aren't forced out of the communities where they grew up.

mentions.tacticalSituation: PS - Don't forget, in many parts of Britain, Labour cannot win. It's a choice between the Lib Dems and the Conservatives.

issues.economy: We will deliver policies that will get our economy moving again.
issues.governance: Whitehall doesn't know best - it's time to bring power back to rural communities across Britain.
issues.health: It's been the Lib Dems who have been fighting to protect our vital services like our NHS, post offices and schools. We have fought to stop developers concreting over some of the most beautiful parts of Britain.

housing.content: We will take action to deliver affordable housing - so that young people aren't forced out of the communities where they grew up.

images.caption: Nick Clegg, Leader of the Liberal Democrats

leaflet.additionalNotes: We are fighting to get a fair deal for people hit hard by Labour's recession.
